questions.question_text: A gas described by van Der Waals equation

option_texts.A: behaves similar to an ideal gas in the limit of large molar volumes.
option_texts.B: behaves similar to an ideal gas in the limit of large pressures.
option_texts.C: is characterized by van der Waals coefficients that are dependent on the identity of the gas but are independent of the temperature.
option_texts.D: has the pressure that is lower than the pressure exerted by the same gas behaving ideally.

questions.question_text:
Consider three planes 
$$${P_1}:x - y + z = 1$$$
$$${P_2}:x + y - z = 1$$$
$$${P_3}:x - 3y + 3z = 2$$$
Let $${L_1},$$ $${L_2},$$ $${L_3}$$ be the lines of intersection of the planes $${P_2}$$ and  $${P_3},$$  $${P_3}$$ and  $${P_1},$$  $${P_1}$$ and  $${P_2},$$ respectively.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let $$f$$ and $$g$$ be real valued functions defined on interval $$(-1, 1)$$ such that $$g''(x)$$ is continuous, $$g\left( 0 \right) \ne 0.$$ $$g'\left( 0 \right) = 0$$, $$g''\left( 0 \right) \ne 0$$, and $$f\left( x \right) = g\left( x \right)\sin x$$ 
STATEMENT - 1: $$\mathop {\lim }\limits_{x \to 0} \,\,\left[ {g\left( x \right)\cot x - g\left( 0 \right)\cos ec\,x} \right] = f''\left( 0 \right)$$ and 


STATEMENT - 2: $$f'\left( 0 \right) = g\left( 0 \right)$$

option_texts.A: Statement - 1 is True, Statement - 2 is True; Statement - 2 is a correct explanation for Statement - 1
option_texts.B: Statement - 1 is True, Statement - 2 is True; Statement - 2 is NOT a correct explanation for Statement - 1
option_texts.C: Statement - 1 is True, Statement -2 is False
option_texts.D: Statement - 1 is False, Statement -2 is True

option_texts.A: four straight lines, when c = 0 and a, b are of the same sign
option_texts.B: two straight lines and a circle, when a = b, and c is of sign opposite to that of a
option_texts.C: two straight lines and a hyperbola, when a and b are of the same sign and c is of sign opposite to that of a
option_texts.D: a circle and an ellipse, when a and b are of the same sign and c is of sign opposite to that of a

Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Consider the system of equations:

$$x-2y+3z=-1$$

$$-x+y-2z=k$$

$$x-3y+4z=1$$

Statement - 1 : The system of equations has no solution for $$k\ne3$$.

and

Statement - 2 : The determinant $$\left| {\matrix{
   1 & 3 & { - 1}  \cr 
   { - 1} & { - 2} & k  \cr 
   1 & 4 & 1  \cr 

 } } \right| \ne 0$$, for $$k \ne 3$$.

option_texts.A: Statement - 1 is True, Statement - 2 is True; Statement - 2 is a correct explanation for Statement - 1
option_texts.B: Statement - 1 is True, Statement - 2 is True; Statement - 2 is NOT a correct explanation for Statement - 1
option_texts.C: Statement - 1 is True, Statement - 2 is False
option_texts.D: Statement - 1 is False, Statement - 2 is True

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Which one of the following statements is WRONG in the context of X-rays generated from a X-ray tube?

option_texts.A: Wavelength of characteristic X-rays decreases when the atomic number of the target increases.
option_texts.B: Cut-off wavelength of the continuous X-rays depends on the atomic number of the target.
option_texts.C: Intensity of the characteristic X-rays depends on the electrical power given to the X-ray tube.
option_texts.D: Cut-off wavelength of the continuous X-rays depends on the energy of the electrons in the X-ray tube.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Two beams of red and violet colours are made to pass separately through a prism (angle of the prism is 60$$^\circ$$). In the position of minimum deviation, the angle of refraction will be :

option_texts.D: equal but not 30$$^\circ$$ for both the colours

questions.subject: Physics
Physics
questions.question_text: Two balls, having linear momenta $${\overrightarrow p _1} = p\widehat i$$ and $${\overrightarrow p _2} =  - p\widehat i$$, undergo a collision in free space. There is no external force acting on the balls. Let $${\overrightarrow {p'} _1}$$ and $${\overrightarrow {p'} _2}$$ be their final momenta. The following option(s) is (are) NOT ALLOWED for any non-zero value of $$p,{a_1},{a_2},{b_1},{b_2},{c_1}$$ and $${c_2}$$ :

option_texts.C: $${\overrightarrow {p'} _1} = {a_1}\widehat i + {b_1}\widehat j + {c_1}\widehat k;{\overrightarrow {p'} _2} = {a_2}\widehat i + {b_2}\widehat j - {c_1}\widehat k$$

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Assume that the nuclear binding energy per nucleon (B/A) versus mass number (A) is as shown in the figure. Use this plot to choose the correct choice(s) given below.

option_texts.A: Fusion of two nuclei with mass number lying in the range of 1 < A < 50 will release energy
option_texts.B: Fusion of two nuclei with mass numbers lying in the range of 51 < A < 100 will release energy
option_texts.C: Fission of a nucleus lying in the mass range of 100 < A < 200 will release energy when broken into two equal fragments
option_texts.D: Fission of a nucleus lying in the mass range of 200 < A < 260 will release energy when broken into two equal fragments

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A particle of mass m and charge q, moving with velocity v enters Region II normal to the boundary as shown in the figure. Region II has a uniform magnetic field B perpendicular to the plane of the paper. The length of the Region II is $$l$$. Choose the correct choice (s).

option_texts.A: The particle enters Region III only if its velocity $$v > {{qlB} \over m}$$
option_texts.B: The particle enters Region III only if its velocity $$v < {{qlB} \over m}$$
option_texts.C: Path length of the particle in Region II is maximum when velocity $$v = {{qlB} \over m}$$
option_texts.D: Time spent in Region II is same for any velocity v as long as the particle returns to Region I

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: In a Young's double slit experiment, the separation between the two slits is d and the wavelength of the light is $$\lambda$$. The intensity of light falling on slit 1 is four times the intensity of light falling on slit 2. Choose the correct choice(s).

option_texts.A: If $$d=\lambda$$, the screen will contain only one maximum
option_texts.B: If $$\lambda < d < 2\lambda$$, at least one more maximum (besides the central maximum) will be observed on the screen
option_texts.C: If the intensity of light falling on slit 1 is reduced so that it becomes equal to that of slit 2, the intensities of the observed dark and bright fringes will increase
option_texts.D: If the intensity of light falling on slit 2 is increased so that it becomes equal to that of slit 1, the intensities of the observed dark and bright fringes will increase

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
STATEMENT - 1

In a Meter Bridge experiment, null point for an unknown resistance is measured. Now, the unknown resistance is put inside an enclosure maintained at a higher temperature. The null point can be obtained at the same point as before by decreasing the value of the standard resistance.

and

STATEMENT - 2

Resistance of a metal increases with increase in temperature.

option_texts.A: Statement - 1 is True, Statement - 2 is True; Statement - 2 is a correct explanation for Statement - 1
option_texts.B: Statement - 1 is True, Statement - 2 is True; Statement - 2 is NOT a correct explanation for Statement - 1
option_texts.C: Statement - 1 is True, Statement - 2 is False
option_texts.D: Statement - 1 is False, Statement - 2 is True

and

option_texts.B: Statement - 1 is True, Statement - 2 is True; Statement - 2 is NOT a correct explanation for Statement - 1
option_texts.C: Statement - 1 is True, Statement - 2 is False
option_texts.D: Statement - 1 is False, Statement - 2 is True

questions.question_text:

Two cylinders, one hollow (metal) and the other solid (wood) with the same mass and identical dimensions are simultaneously allowed to roll without slipping down an inclined plane from the same height. The hollow cylinder will reach the bottom of the inclined plane first.

and

STATEMENT - 2 :

By the principle of conservation of energy, the total kinetic energies of both the cylinders are identical when they reach the bottom of the incline.

option_texts.A: Statement - 1 is True, Statement - 2 is True; Statement - 2 is a correct explanation for Statement - 1
option_texts.B: Statement - 1 is True, Statement - 2 is True; Statement - 2 is NOT a correct explanation for Statement - 1

option_texts.D: Statement - 1 is False, Statement - 2 is True

and

STATEMENT - 2 :

In any steady flow of an incompressible fluid, the volume flow rate of the fluid remains constant.

option_texts.A: Statement - 1 is True, Statement - 2 is True; Statement - 2 is a correct explanation for Statement - 1
option_texts.B: Statement - 1 is True, Statement - 2 is True; Statement - 2 is NOT a correct explanation for Statement - 1

option_texts.D: Statement - 1 is False, Statement - 2 is True
